intro: Toga surukensis, commonly known as the silverleaf orchid, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its velvety, silver-green leaves and clusters of delicate, white or pale pink flowers. The plant thrives in cool, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its unique appearance makes it a sought-after species among botanists and horticulturists. Due to habitat loss, Toga surukensis is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
